entry.title: Evolution of Data and Analytics with SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction to Business Data Cloud:

SAP Business Data Cloud was introduced on February 13 2025 as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution fully managed by SAP. SAP Business Data Cloud is a data & analytics platform that harmonizes all data from SAP and non-SAP sources into a unified semantic layer of trusted data that governs, connects and share data securely across systems or cloud. By integrating powerful functionality of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Databricks and SAP Business Warehouse. It empowers businesses to break data silos to power advanced AI and analytics.

Why was Business data cloud introduced?

  • To get easier access to SAP data without the need for complex data preparation steps such as extraction, building semantics, transformation and loading data for analytics.
  • To get access to all SAP data from all Line of Business (LoB) applications, such as SAP S/4HANA, SAP SuccessFactors and SAP Ariba without the need of 3rd party connector & tool.
  • To get a unified business view of the data regardless of which SAP application it originated from without making harmonization difficult and holds its original business context without any change.
  • To accelerate AI with trusted and secure data that they can use to build reliable AI applications to accelerate innovation and insights with AI.
  • To get faster access to SAP data insights by removing data preparation and dashboard building steps.
  • To get a Simplified Landscape by reducing multiple tools, silos and complex tasks of manual data preparation, development and analytics.

Key Features & Capabilities of Business Data Cloud: 

SAP Business Data Cloud Key Innovation of out-of-the-box components

  • Intelligent Applications: Intelligent Applications are predefined, SAP-managed dashboards for analytics based on underlying Data Products and models.
  • Data Products: Create and share governed, reusable data products that deliver consistent, high-quality business information across teams and systems.
  • BDC Cockpit: Centrally manage your data products, monitor usage, and enforce governance policies, all from one intuitive interface.

SAP Business Data Cloud Integrated Software components:

  • SAP Datasphere: to provide the data integration and modelling.
  • SAP Analytics Cloud: to provide the analysis and planning.
  • SAP Databricks: to provide AI and machine learning enhancements.
  • SAP BW/BW4HANA: can be used as a data source for datasphere & databricks.

SAP Business Data Cloud is built on SAP Business Technology Platform:

  • Unified Customer Landscape used to connect the SAP Business Data Cloud components.
  • SAP HANA Cloud provides the data storage layer.
  • SAP Security and Compliance to manage access and permissions and governs regulatory compliance.
  • SAP Development & Integration to provide developer tools for modelling & data Integration
  • SAP AI & Analytics to provide advanced analytics and AI powered insights.

SAP Business Data Cloud Architecture:

  • Source System layer: It harmonizes all data from SAP and non-SAP sources, into a unified semantic layer of trusted data, to power advanced analytics and to build AI applications.
  • Foundation Service Layer: This layer replicates and harmonizes data from the source systems to produce curated, governed Data Products that retain their original business context. Data products are grouped by Data Packages to make it easy to discover them and to activate them. This data is stored in a hyper scaler environment using SAP HANA Cloud and Data Lake files.
  • Business Data Fabric Layer: It combines the strengths of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), and SAP Business Warehouse (BW) capabilities, enhanced by the Databricks platform to unify an organization with SAP and Non ‚Äì SAP and third-party data into a single, trusted foundation model.
  • SAP Datasphere is the technological foundation for the business data fabric within BDC. It integrates, transforms, and enriches data from SAP and non-SAP sources into powerful semantic models. Data can be replicated into Datasphere for faster performance or accessed virtually from its source, allowing for flexible management of a hybrid data landscape.
  • SAP Databricks is an Advanced AI and machine learning technology. It provides a pro-code environment for data engineers and AI developers to build, train, and deploy custom AI and ML models using the rich, semantically aware data from SAP applications.
  • SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BW/4HANA: For customers with existing on-premises SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BW/4HANA systems, this component provides a modernization path within the Business Data Fabric. A Data Product Generator can be used to convert BW Info Provider data into cloud-ready data products, which can then be consumed by Datasphere for analytics or by Databricks for AI/ML.
  • SAP Business Data Cockpit: SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit allows you to browse and find pre delivered Intelligent Applications and data products, install Intelligent Applications, and share data products with SAP Datasphere & Databricks to enable analytics & enrich with AI and machine learning capabilities.
  • Intelligent Application Layer: It‚Äôs a unified semantic layer of trusted data, to power advanced AI & Analytics.
  • SAP Analytical Cloud: Using SAP Analytics Cloud, business users can run ad-hoc analysis, explore the provided data with AI-driven chat capabilities, or act on their insights with AI-driven suggestions, bridging the gap between analytics and their end-to-end business processes.
  • Intelligent Application: SAP Business Data Cloud Intelligent Applications are used to provide the required dashboard in out-of-the-box reporting scenarios with its advanced visualization and planning functions
  • Joule: Joule uses natural language processing to interact, access insights, and perform tasks across SAP and third-party applications. It uses "agents" and "skills" to automate multi-step workflows and provide contextual assistance.

How SAP Business Data Cloud work as one domain model:

Scenario 1: Out-of-the-Box model with Datasphere

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: Visual representations of the insights are automatically generated and made available in the intelligent application dashboard.

 Scenario 2:  AI and machine learning enhancement by Databricks

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: Visual representations of the insights are automatically generated and made available in the intelligent application dashboard.

Step 6: Integration of SAP Databricks

It is possible to extend the results shown in the dashboard with machine learning and AI based Insights, to do so use the SAP business data cockpit to share data product with databricks,

In SAP Databricks AI and Machine learning techniques are used to generate the desired result, this results then shared back to the data model and extend your dashboard with AI and Machine learning insights.

Scenario 2:  : Integration of SAP BW & SAP Analytical Cloud

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP BDC cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: This is where the integration of your third-party data comes into play. The advanced integration and data modelling capabilities of SAP Datasphere allow you to integrate your third-party data into the out-of-the-box data model.

Step 6: Integration of SAP BW

It is also possible to integrate your existing objects from SAP BW/4HANA into SAP Business Data Cloud. With a dedicated data provisioning tool, you can onboard your SAP BW objects into SAP Datasphere and combine them with the existing data model.

Step 7: Integration of SAP Analytical Cloud 

SAP Business Data Cloud provides a wide range of consumption options on top of your data model. Use the AI-based Just Ask feature in SAP Analytics Cloud. The power of its natural language processing allows you to request information from your data model simply by typing a question about your data. Answers are instantly displayed in the most appropriate format.

Role of Source system & Data product in BDC:

Role of Datasphere in BDC:

 Role of Databricks in BDC:

 Role of BW in BDC:

 Role of SAC in BDC:

 Role of Intelligent Application Dashboard & Joule in BDC:

 
Use Case of Business Data Cloud:

SAP Business Data Cloud can handle many use-cases including:

  • Data Integration & Modelling 
  • Data Governance and Compliance 
  • Development of AI and machine learning models
  • Data Warehousing
  • Planning and BI 
  • Development of intelligent applications to support all business processes.
  • End-to-end data lifecycle management by SAP 

SAP Business Data Cloud reaches all personas of the organization.

Conclusion: 

Data from all SAP applications is combined and made available to the businesses under a single domain model. With SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP has reached the next level of data and analytics evolution to tackle challenges and enables businesses to seamlessly integrate, harmonize, and analyse data from multiple sources, transforming raw data into valuable insights with advanced AI and analytics. 

By adopting the latest 2025 features, organizations can accelerate analytics, improve decision-making, and prepare for AI-driven innovation.

Reference:

Learning Journey: https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/exploring-sap-business-data-cloud
Live Session : https://learning.sap.com/live-sessions/overview-of-sap-business-data-cloud
SAP Help Document : https://help.sap.com/docs/business-data-cloud
GenAI Assistance : Assistance in drafting the structure of blog.

entry.title: Esri study shows HANA Cloud is a good choice for your ArcGIS Enterprise Geodatabase
entry.content:
I've been blogging about SAP HANA Cloud, SAP HANA database as a great option for your enterprise geodatabase since 2021.  As long as HANA Cloud is in the same region and the same hyperscalar as SAP S/4HANA in RISE with SAP , you will get optimal performance by minimizing network latency.  I am elated that Esri has run this preliminary test and will run a more extensive test scaling user load at a later date.  They have confirmed what I've been blogging about for 4+ years!  If you want to check out all of my blogs on ArcGIS - SAP integration on SAP Community, you can read my blogs, you can view them all here. and here.

The blog in the ArcGIS Architecture Center (see my first blog on SAP Community for more information on Esri's work) describes a test Esri conducted to simulate a medium size gas utility running a standard set of real world workflows consisting of 15 editors and 200 web viewers.  The Utility Network consists of a dataset with a geographic extent of roughly 55,000 square miles, and with an overall size of approximately 45 GB. The dataset contained roughly nine million features, 700 sub-networks, and 300,000 gas meters.  Esri has run these same set of tests against #RISE with SAP and you can find details in that blog on how Esri runs these tests, what the workflows are and what other HANA related tests they've run.

Here are the performance graphs from the test that Esri just ran.  There is plenty of headroom (CPU, memory and disk) and workflows are executing in a timely fashion - workflows aren't building up because the system is running with good performance.  SAP HANA Cloud, SAP HANA database is using < 4% CPU (6th graph from the top on the left).

If you compare these results to the results from the RISE with SAP study that Esri ran in April, you will see there is plenty of headroom both on HANA Cloud and on the ArcGIS servers.  Even though this is a 1x expected load (15 editors and 200 web users), I expect when Esri runs 2x, 4x and higher number of users, HANA Cloud will behave similarly to the graphs below which show 8x the number of users against HANA cloud-resident in RISE with SAP .  This graph also shows Single VPC which means HANA cloud-resident and ArcGIS Enterprise in the same VPC.

ArcGIS on HANA in RISE with SAP

Performance is important, but what else does this mean to utilities who are in RISE with SAP and need to put their ArcGIS Enterprise landscape and geodatabase in the cloud?  It means that HANA Cloud is a viable choice that brings along with it the ability to expose SAP S/4HANA Plant Maintenance master and transactional data in workflows via ArcGIS Enterprise.  Not only does this produce more efficient workflows and business processes but this also means ArcGIS powerful spatial analytics can be applied to that master and transactional data within the context of asset location, DERs and power consumption (due to EV charging for instance).  With these two systems of record for a utility in the SAP Business Technology Platform , this opens the door to GeoAI and leveraging that data with SAP Business Data Cloud.

Even more compelling is that as SAP customers embrace SAP S/4HANA Cloud, extended edition, they can integrate their spatial, master and transactional data the same way because SAP HANA Cloud, SAP HANA database has the ability to connect to SAP S/4HANA Cloud, extended edition.. That means ArcGIS Enterprise can query ABAP CDS views to obtain master and transactional data on the fly - just like ArcGIS on SAP HANA and RISE with SAP S/4HANA.  What makes this possible is both SAP HANA (as of HANA 2 SPS8) and SAP HANA Cloud, SAP HANA database now support the ABAP ODBC driver which can connect to both on-prem and cloud resident S/4HANA instances and well as S/4HANA Cloud.

With SAP and Esri customers successfully leveraging the SAP - ArcGIS integration in both cloud, cloud resident and on-prem landscapes and Esri showing HANA Cloud performs well, now is the time put your geodatabases on SAP HANA Cloud, SAP HANA database and realize the same value that OGE, NiSource and others are.

Note: the screenshots are from the Esri studies linked to in this blog.  All rights belong to their respective owners.

entry.title: Innovating for a Circular Future: What‚Äôs new in Waste and Recycling in S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
As the world continues to place increasing emphasis on sustainability ‚Äì waste management and recycling have taken center stage in the journey towards a circular economy. At SAP, we are committed to support this shift and provide continuous innovation in our Waste and Recycling solution. In this blog, I‚Äôm excited to share some of the key innovations and features with the latest release of S/4HANA 2025 FPS0.

1. Laying the foundation with CDS Views

Core Data Services (CDS) Views have emerged as a cornerstone of modern SAP system architecture, enabling streamlined data modelling and real-time access to relevant information. In the context of SAP Waste and Recycling, CDS Views provide the foundation for efficient data management and analytics by centralizing and structuring data across various modules. This not only simplifies reporting and operational decision-making but also paves the way for more advanced capabilities, such as analytics and integrations. Some of the CDS views are also available from the previous release (2023).

  • Waste Disposal Orders

SAP waste disposal orders are core documents used in SAP S/4HANA for Waste and Recycling to manage and track the collection and transport of waste on specific planned routes. The order includes a header (route, date, start time) and line items (customer, contract, service type, address). For further information, refer - Analysis and Overview of Waste Disposal Orders

  • Weighing Documents

When vehicles carrying waste arrive at, or leave, a facility such as a landfill, incineration plant, or recycling center, they are weighed using a connected weighbridge, and these results are recorded directly in SAP S/4HANA as weighing transactions. These transactions are directly linked to waste disposal orders or contracts ensuring that the actual quantities collected, delivered, or processed are precisely documented and associated with the correct customer, contract, and order item. This ensures transparency for billing, regulatory compliance, and operational analysis. For further information, refer - Weighing Transactions ‚Äì Multi Item Weighing

  • Containers Management

Container allocation forms the central component that binds the technical equipment information (containers) with the relevant service information (waste materials, service types, frequency, start dates etc. For further information, refer Containers Tracking

  • Route Management

CDS views for Routes provide information related to different routes based on region, service types, service areas, container categories etc. You can also enable the retrieval of route identification with equipment, service number item details with its service location, interval type, and category, and resources related to the route. For further details pls refer -  Routes

  • Waste Sales Contracts

This CDS view is for the waste specific sales contracts. It provides a view of the contracts which are active and have containers allocated to their premise. For further details, refer Waste & Recycling Sales Contracts

2. Tare Based Weighing

Tare weight or vehicle weight can be maintained in the vehicle/equipment master data. Multi Item weighing transaction will automatically consider & populate the tare weight maintained in the master data to arrive at the ‚ÄúNET‚Äù weight. This eliminates the need for a second weighing of the empty vehicle to complete & post the weighing transaction thereby improving the operational efficiency. For further details, refer - Tare Weight Auto-Populate

3. Introducing Output Management and Control within Weighbridge Application

Output Management and Control in SAP S/4HANA provides a standardised framework for manging the creation, formatting and distribution of business documents such as invoices, delivery notes across different channels like print, email and electronic formats. By enabling the Weighbridge application to leverage this standard framework, we bring the same level of consistency, control and automation within waste and recycling facilities.

For further details refer - Integration with S/4 Output Management

4. Enabling Real -Time Insights with Weighing Overview Fiori App

With this release, we introduce our first analytical Fiori app providing a unified and intuitive interface to all Weighing records that allow users to monitor both internal and external weighing records. Supervisors and planners can now visualize trends, identify bottlenecks and take timely actions driving greater transparency, agility and operational excellence.

For further details refer - Weighing Overview

Want to contribute to the future roadmap?  

Join our  Continuous Influence - Waste & Recycling in S/4HANA  program today and help shape the future of Waste and Recycling in SAP S/4HANA. For more details about the program you can also refer this  blog .

entry.title: Data entity with the same name already exists
entry.content:
Scenario having multiple Data Entities named the same from different DB.  It is not possible to add an Data entity with the same name. F.e.
Project A tables:
- MainATable
- DocumentHistory
- Attachments

Project B tables:
- MainBTable
- DocumentHistory
- Attachments

This will lead you into the problem that you only can add one DocumentHistory and one Attachments table at the same time, nevertheless they don't belong together.

Instead of adding them in the background as ProjectA.DocumentHistory and ProjectB.DocumentHistory - the more I work with it, the more I get frustrated!

entry.title: Re: Request for Guidance on Integrating SAP HANA On-Premi...
entry.content:
Hi Andrea,

Dear customer,

Thank you for contacting SAP Support.

Regarding your specific requirement, SAP CALM can indeed connect to HANA databases to retrieve information. 
However, this functionality is limited to HANA databases running in a cloud environment, such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.  
You can refer to 'Setup Managed Components (Services & Systems)' to see the products which CALM can be connected. 

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: ü™ê Comet Browser for SAP Users: Practical Browser Automation for Fiori, SuccessFactors & Beyond
entry.content:
Perplexity‚Äôs new **Comet** browser turns everyday SAP web work (Fiori apps, SuccessFactors, BTP cockpit, Ariba, etc.) into **prompt-driven automations**: think ‚Äúopen My Inbox, filter purchase orders > ‚Ç¨10k awaiting approval, export to CSV, and email me the summary.‚Äù It‚Äôs fast to try, fits neatly alongside your SAP landscape, and‚Äîused with the right guardrails‚Äîcan save hours of repetitive clicks each week.

---

## Who is this for?

- **Fiori power users** who triage tasks in **My Inbox**, **Manage Purchase Orders**, **Manage Sales Orders**, or **Monitor Stock** daily.
- **HR ops** working in **SuccessFactors** (e.g., bulk checks, report exports, onboarding lists).
- **BTP admins** navigating the **SAP BTP Cockpit**, toggling service instances, roles, and destinations.
- **Procurement/finance** teams using **Ariba** and **S/4HANA** web apps that require routine filters, exports, and cross-checks.

---

## Why Comet helps SAP users

1. **Prompt ‚Üí Action**: Ask Comet to perform structured browser tasks across tabs (navigate, search, filter, export, summarize). This feels like a ‚Äúuniversal assistant‚Äù for your SAP web apps‚Äîespecially helpful when hopping between Fiori tiles, SuccessFactors modules, and admin consoles.
2. **Research & context**: Need policy reminders, note formats, or KPI definitions while inside the app? Comet augments pages with in-place explanations and follow-ups without losing context.
3. **Collections & cleanup**: Group related SAP tabs (e.g., period-end close) and let Comet tidy dormant tabs automatically.
4. **Chromium DNA**: Built on Chromium, so everyday browsing patterns feel familiar and enterprise web apps behave as expected.
5. **Pricing & availability**: Comet is now broadly available (with free access and paid tiers); check Perplexity for current details and options.

---

## Five high-impact automation recipes (SAP-ready)

> Use **non-production** systems first. Validate each step. Keep approvals human-in-the-loop.

1. **Fiori mass triage (My Inbox)**
‚ÄúOpen My Inbox > filter by ‚ÄòOverdue‚Äô and ‚ÄòAmount > ‚Ç¨10,000‚Äô > group by Company Code > export summary to CSV > draft an email with top 10 items and due dates.‚Äù
_Value:_ reduces tab gymnastics, yields a tidy escalation deck in minutes.

2. **SuccessFactors onboarding checks**
‚ÄúOpen SuccessFactors > People Analytics > run ‚ÄòNew Hires last 7 days‚Äô > flag records missing manager or start date > export and summarize blockers.‚Äù
_Value:_ HR gets a daily exception list, not a raw dump.

3. **Fiori spend variance pulse**
‚ÄúOpen Manage Purchase Orders > filter current month > variance >5% vs contract > list top 20 by supplier; open each PO in a new tab; capture notes field; compile a single-page brief.‚Äù
_Value:_ pre-curated review pack for controllers.

4. **BTP cockpit housekeeping**
‚ÄúOpen BTP Cockpit > subaccount X > list service instances with Warning or Error state > fetch last 20 logs per instance > summarize common failures and suggest likely fix (quota, bindings, plan).‚Äù
_Value:_ faster incident triage for platform teams.

5. **Ariba price drift watch**
‚ÄúAriba > reports > compare last quarter unit prices vs catalog; surface items with >8% drift; generate CSV and bullet summary with supplier names.‚Äù
_Value:_ quick input for sourcing discussions.

---

## Prompts you can copy-paste

- ‚ÄúOpen **Fiori My Inbox** in S/4HANA and filter to **‚ÄòHigh Priority‚Äô** + **‚ÄòOverdue‚Äô**. For each item, open details in a background tab, extract **Vendor**, **Amount**, **Requested Delivery**, and **Approver Chain**. Build a table and export it.‚Äù
- ‚ÄúIn **SuccessFactors**, pull **Headcount by Department** for the last 30 days, highlight **departures**, and list missing **exit interviews**. Draft a note to HRBP with the topline and attach the CSV.‚Äù
- ‚ÄúGo to **BTP Cockpit** ‚Üí **Subaccount X** ‚Üí **Security** ‚Üí **Role Collections**. Snapshot role assignments changed in the last 48 hours and summarize who gained admin-like rights.‚Äù

---

## Fit with SAP testing & governance

- **Don‚Äôt replace UI tests**: For deterministic app testing, keep using **QUnit/OPA5** and your CI/CD pipeline. Comet is an **ops assistant**, not a test harness.
- **Least privilege**: Use **read-only** roles where possible for reporting workflows; elevate only when human approvals are part of the flow.
- **SSO & audit**: Run via corporate SSO, keep browser logs, and retain human approval steps for sensitive actions.

---

## A word on security (read this)

Independent write-ups and audits have flagged **security considerations** around AI-driven browsers‚Äîespecially where the agent can act on web content. That means you should:
- **Disable auto-actions** on untrusted sites,
- **Limit sensitive scopes** (banking, payroll, PII),
- **Pilot in sandboxes** before production.

Make an informed choice with your security team.

---

## Getting started in 10 minutes

1. **Install Comet** and sign in with your Perplexity account.
2. **Create a ‚ÄúSAP Ops‚Äù collection** (Fiori launchpad, SuccessFactors Admin Center, BTP Cockpit, Ariba).
3. **Try one recipe** above on a **dev** tenant.
4. **Review outputs** (CSV, summaries, emails) before sending.
5. **Iterate prompts**: add filters, sort keys, and exception rules.

---

## What good looks like (quick checklist)

- ‚è±Ô∏è **<5 min** from prompt to usable report
- üëÄ **Human review** before any approval or posting step
- üõ°Ô∏è **SSO + least privilege** + audit trail retained
- üîÅ **Repeatable** prompts saved to a shared team collection

---

## Free month of Perplexity Pro (referral)

If you want to trial Pro features while evaluating Comet for SAP workflows, here‚Äôs a referral link the team can use:

```
https://pplx.ai/noptus
```

---

## Final thoughts

Comet won‚Äôt replace your SAP skills‚Äîit **amplifies** them. Start with simple browser flows you repeat daily, keep humans in the loop, and let the assistant handle the clicks while you focus on decisions. If your team already lives in Fiori and SuccessFactors, this is one of the **lowest-friction** AI wins you can pilot this quarter.

*P.S. If you‚Äôre curious about long-term fit (policies, data residency, enterprise controls), loop in your security and platform teams early and evaluate Comet alongside your existing SAP governance and testing practices.*
